page.title: 08Going Shopping.
page.content: Our area has two{grocery shops}which are also off-licences and newsagents. These shops also have cooked meat and delicatessen counters, and one has a pet and garden centre as part of it. The{post office}also sells food. There are{two butchers}and a{bakery}which open most days of the week. Some people like to shop in the larger {supermarkets and cash and carries}in Liskeard, Launceston and Plymouth, where prices are often lower. Clothes, furniture and other large goods are often bought at Trago Mills (a shopping centre near Liskeard) or Plymouth. Many people also shop by {mail order,}looking at things in catalogues and buying by post. Very often the goods are paid for by instalments over a period of several months. {Simon James Fitton. {Neil Alexander Holland.
